dataModel.description: Please include a description and attach images. This information is intended for potential use by the Department in publicly promoting the program. 2.1 Provide a short summary of what has been achieved to date against the project outcomes during this reporting period as outlined in the MERI plan.
(This includes if the project is on track to meet targets overall, any key governance or project milestones. Keep your answer concise and do not repeat activity specific information which will be reported against the services and targets below.)

columns.title: Outcome No.
Short Term Outcome
Achievement against the outcome

columns.title: Issue No.
Nature of the issue
How you are managing, or proposing to manage, the issue?
Implications for the project
columns.helpText: (e.g. Impacts on timeframes, feasibility, costs, ability to meet contracted deliverables)

viewModel.title: 2.3 If yes, please outline in the table below:

items.preLabel: 2.4 Has the plan for project implementation undergone a review or amendment during this reporting period?
2.5 If yes, please provide a summary of the changes.
2.6 Will these changes require a formal variation to the MERI Plan? If yes, your project manager will follow up with you to discuss.
2.7 Are there any new or emerging risks to the delivery of the Project?
items.helpText: As distinct from WHS to personnel and subcontractors, for example, there may have been a flooding event on site which impacts works. Please describe any new or emerging project delivery risks.

items.preLabel: 2.8 Has the project risks table in MERIT been updated in this reporting period?
items.helpText: if you manage your project risks out of MERIT please select Not applicable

items.source: 3. Project Workplace Health and Safety (WHS) Risk

items.preLabel: 3.1 During this reporting period, have any notifiable incidents or events occurred during the delivery of the project services?

3.2 If yes, has the incident/event been reported to the department and the relevant documentation provided? Please note, the department should be informed of notifiable incidents as soon as practical.

3.3 Have you verified that all subcontractors engaged during the reporting period (existing and new) are meeting WHS requirements 
            under this contract, and that corroborating documentation such as relevant permits, licences etc have been retained?
3.4 If no, provide reason on why checks have not been undertaken.

items.source: 4.1 Provide a summary of any monitoring or evaluation activities undertaken this period, including any key findings and any changes you have made in response to these activities (where required)

items.preLabel: 5.1 Are there any good news stories, project achievements, or major milestones which highlight what the project is doing/achieving?
If yes, please upload an image and describe the potential good news story, or provide link or copy of the material.

items.source:
Survey information

Before completing this section, please ensure you have created a Data Set Summary information for every data set produced by the surveys you intend to report

  • Each survey reported must relate to a combination of outcomes as described in your MERI plan
  • Each Data Set Summary recorded for a survey must be addressing the same outcomes as selected for the survey
  • Each Data Set Summary recorded for a baseline survey must be a baseline data set. Similarly, each Data Set Summary recorded for an indicator survey must be a indicator data set.
  • If a survey produced more than one data set, use the New Data Set button to add each Data Set Summary under your survey
  • A single survey can be made up of multiple dataset

items.source:
Survey information

Before completing this section, please ensure you have created a Data Set Summary information for every data set produced by the surveys you intend to report

  • Each survey reported must relate to a combination of outcomes as described in your MERI plan
  • Each Data Set Summary recorded for a survey must be addressing the same outcomes as selected for the survey
  • Each Data Set Summary recorded for a baseline survey must be a baseline data set. Similarly, each Data Set Summary recorded for an indicator survey must be a indicator data set.
  • If a survey produced more than one data set, use the New Data Set button to add each Data Set Summary under your survey
  • A single survey can be made up of multiple dataset

items.source:
Survey information

Before completing this section, please ensure you have created a Data Set Summary information for every data set produced by the surveys you intend to report

  • Each survey reported must relate to a combination of outcomes as described in your MERI plan
  • Each Data Set Summary recorded for a survey must be addressing the same outcomes as selected for the survey
  • Each Data Set Summary recorded for a baseline survey must be a baseline data set. Similarly, each Data Set Summary recorded for an indicator survey must be a indicator data set.
  • If a survey produced more than one data set, use the New Data Set button to add each Data Set Summary under your survey
  • A single survey can be made up of multiple dataset
